main event: A circular object was sighted over Fairbanks, Alaska on December 29, 1956.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a pea with colors red, bluish-white, and a green tail., The duration of the observation was only 2-3 seconds., Witnesses included an air control tower operator and pilots from Wien Airlines., There were reports of flare activity in the same area on previous occasions., The sighting was ultimately concluded to most likely be a flare fired by unknown individuals.
sighted object: one circular object with colors red, bluish-white, and a green tail
witnesses: air control tower operator and pilots
